Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I really like Valentine's Day in this office. It's kinda like grade school. Everybody gives out little presents and stuff. Like last year, Jim gave me this card, with Dwight's head on it, it was horrifying and funny and...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Delivery man enters with a bouquet of red roses. Pam stands up to look at card.] Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Delivery man
Quote.Text: Would you sign here? [Phyllis gets up from desk and walks over.]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Roy and I are saving for the wedding, so I made him promise not to get me anything too big.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: "Happy Valentine's Day darling. Love Bob Vance, Vance Refrigeration."

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Isn't he sweet?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah. Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright Dwight, as you know I am heading to New York today. [Dwight holds up passport.] Doing a presentation on the branch to the new CFO.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And you want me to come with you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope. The opposite of that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will stay here and run things on this end.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Question. Will you be seeing Jan when you're in New York?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I probably will, why do you ask?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well... It's Valentine's Day, and you guys, you know...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Screwed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is your problem?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is a business trip. I would have to be a raving lunatic to try to talk to Jan about what happened between us. Her words, not mine. She sent me an email this morning. But, it is Valentine's Day. It's New York. City of Love.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Pam. You heart N.Y., right? You want me to pick you up anything?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: The best present would be, you do a good job in front of the new CFO.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dude, I'm gonna nail it. Me in New York? Oh, I own that city. Fuggedaboudit! See ya!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well here we go. On our way to New York. New York, New York. City so nice they named it twice. Manhattan is the other name.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So I broke up with Katy and haven't been dating anybody else, so this year I don't have to worry about Valentine's Day. It's gonna be good. I invited a couple of friends over. We're gonna play some cards and I'll end up winning a lotta money. Because, they're idiots. It's gonna be great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's this? What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I dunno, it's on your desk.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, but who put it here? And for what purpose?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It was there when I sat down.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [opens box and reads card] Happy Valentine's Day. [pulls out bobble head] It's me. I'm the bobble head. Yes! [Angela smirks in background] Ahh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The meeting isn't 'til three, but I always like to come to New York little bit early and hit some of my favorite hunts, like right here, is my favorite New York pizza joint. And I'm gonna go get me a New York slice. [Michael walks toward Sbarro.]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey Kelly. What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Nothing. Oh except, oh my God Jim. Last night, Ryan and I totally, finally hooked up. It was awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OH, that's great. I'm really happy for [starts to walk away]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: And it was so funny 'cause we were at this bar with his friends and I was sitting next to him the whole night and he wasn't making a move, so in my head I was like "Ryan, what's taking you so long?" And then he kissed me. And I didn't know what to say.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So I said, "Ryan, what took you so long?" And I just said that to him, can you believe that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God, Jim, is that embarrassing? I'm embarrassed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, don't be.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, thank God, because I was nervous, Jim, you will not believe.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I bet.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So nervous, but now -- now I have a boyfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. [Kelly squeals]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [anguished] I hooked up with her on February 13th.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here it is, heart of New York City, Times Square. Named for the good times you have when you're in it. Most people when they come to New York, they go straight to the Empire State Building, that's pretty touristy. I come here. Great places to eat. [points] We have Bubba Gump Shrimp, Red Lobster down there. Ya know. This is, this is the heart of civilization, right here.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Woah. [Delivery man with flowers]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Guess what?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Really, Oh, they're from Bob again.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's great. [Meredith scowls]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody takes the subway in New York. It's fast, it's efficient, gets you there on time. It's a way to [turns and rushes back up stairs] Okay, there's a guy pooping in a cardboard box down there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is the world famous Rockefeller Center. Founded, of course by Theodore Rockefeller. This is a skating rink and I think the Rangers practice there sometimes and it's, that's Tina Fey [points]. That's Tina Fey from Saturday Night Live. Hello? Hello, hi? [walks over] OH, I'm sorry, I thought you were [Conan O'Brien walks in front of Michael], OK, I thought that was. She, she looked a lot like Tina Fey. [to camera] Hello, hello, I thought that was Tina Fey, but it wasn't. So... Are you serious? He was here? When, when I was talking to the fake Tina Fey? Come on! And are you, argh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello Angela. Did you hear, somebody rocked the house and got me the best present I've ever gotten.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Really? I wouldn't know anything about that, but I'm glad you enjoyed it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh I did. I did.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I didn't get anything for Valentine's Day.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, I bet you will before the day is over.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Really? Well, I hope I do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would love to live in New York someday. It's a big dream of mine. Work for corporate, with Jan. It'd be awesome. Go to Broadway shows, eat hot dogs. Scranton is great, but New York, is like Scranton on acid, no on speed, no on steroids. [Michael sees it's the end of a street.] OK, umm, I think, that's either the Hudson or the East, so we're back, should be back this way. There's a lotta pressure on me right now. It's like Michael Jordan, in the NBA finals. Or, like Stormin' Norman Schwarzkopf, and this presentation is desert storm and as soon as it's over, we will not have to deal with those Iraqis anymore. Let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone] Nah that's alright. Spend money on her, instead of giving it to us. That's fine. No, I didn't even have a seat for you anyway. Yeah, hahaha, alright man, have a good night. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Woah, woah [Delivery man with oversized bear]

Quote.Speaker: Delivery man
Quote.Text: Phyllis Lapin.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OH, Holy God!

Quote.Speaker: Delivery man
Quote.Text: It's from Bob.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Man, that thing's bigger than I am.

Quote.Speaker: Delivery man
Quote.Text: No, it's not.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh zip it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There they are. What's up? Hey hey.

Quote.Speaker: Craig
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Michael Scott. [sticks out hand for handshake]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Josh Porter, high five. [They high five] Bam.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: You know Dan Gore from Buffalo.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, how ya doing? Nobody needs to introduce this guy. Craiggers. [bump fists]

Quote.Speaker: Craig
Quote.Text: What's up buddy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You have been kicked out of every strip club in Albany, is that true?

Quote.Speaker: Craig
Quote.Text: Guilty, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So what's going on? What I miss?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Not much, they're uh, I guess running late upstairs, so we're just waiting for the presentations.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cool. Good, good, good. Give us some time to catch up, and... [awkward silence]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam. Hi, How ya doing? Good. Listen, uh may I speak with you... privately?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You can't fire me, Dwight, just 'cause Michael's not here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Pam, Just. Just, [tilts head away, towards another room]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You need to get something for your girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [same time as Pam] Girlfriend. Yes, and the reason I didn't get anything for this particular person - who shall remain nameless - is that she's not really the kind of person you'd think would be into Valentine's Day. She's kind of...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Tightly wound?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: (smirking) Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok, well, sometimes the gift is really about the gesture, you know, like what it means, instead of what it is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You mean, like a ham?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, not like a ham. It's about doing something, so that the person knows that you really care about her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, I get it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That you remember her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, shut up. I know exactly what to do. [gets up and leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: What about you, Craig, you lose anyone?

Quote.Speaker: Craig
Quote.Text: Oh man, Jan, called me in September and said "You gotta fire four people," and I was just like, "What?" Ya know?

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Did you?

Quote.Speaker: Craig
Quote.Text: No, I just ignored her. She's the worse.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: She is our boss.

Quote.Speaker: Craig
Quote.Text: She ain't my boss dude. I don't work for that bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ay, Kay. Come on, you know, that's not. Cool it.

Quote.Speaker: Craig
Quote.Text: What? You like Jan? How can you like Jan?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe because she's my girlfriend. [starts retracting statement] Was, or not my girlfriend. She's... we hooked up and...

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: You hooked up with Jan?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, months ago, just once, It's, just stupid. Just forget it,

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Yeah, let's change the subject.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't know what he's thinking, but I would just be so psyched if we just dated forever.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Take it slow. 'Cause it seems like a lot of the time things like that need... [Ryan walks in]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Soda.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [to Ryan] Cool. Hey, so... do you want to... do something tonight? Or...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [under breath] Oh, no, not while I'm here.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I mean, I know it's Valentine's Day, or whatever, but there's totally no pressure at all, of any kind. What so ever. So...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I can't tonight. I have plans with my friends.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: OK, That's cool. I completely understand.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Cool. Cool. OK.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Josh Porter, Stamford.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: David [to Josh and shakes hands]

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: And Michael Scott, Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ditto. [to Jan] How are you Jan?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Fine Michael. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: OK. So we are in the process of doing a complete review of the company's financial strengths. All I'd like to do today is to...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Nervous, no I'm not nervous. Well, I guess I'd be lying if I didn't say I was a little nervous. Umm, the new CFO is judging me on this too, and well, it is Michael, so. Yeah, I'm very nervous.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: So with the twelve new local accounts, we had a total of four percent organic growth, which was just above our pre-year targets.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Thanks very much.

Quote.Speaker: Josh
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: OK, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is a business? Is it a collection of numbers and sales reports? Sure. But as you know, David and Jan, it is much more. [plays video on screen. David and Jan have confused looks on their faces.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Life moves a little slower in Scranton, Pennsylvania. And that's the way we like it. Because at Dunder Mifflin Scranton, we're not just in the paper business, we're in the people business. Let's meet some of the folks that make the Scranton branch so special. This is Stanley Hudson, one of our talented salesman. An African-American father of two, Stanley's dedication is no doubt one of the hallmark's of the foundation of the business we're hoping to build our bases on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I shot a bunch of footage around the office, edited it together on my Mac. I was thinking of entering it into some festivals. Probably won't. You know, not what this is about.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And finally, Pam Beesly. Look at her. Look how cute. Not bad at all. As the receptionist, Pam is truly the gateway to our world. Well, I hope this gave you a little taste of what life is like here at Dunder Mifflin, Scranton. What it's like to walk a mile in Oscar's shoes. Or try on Phyllis' pants. Maybe even one of Angela's famous brownies. And you'll know, that you're home.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Questions?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Wow. OK, OK, thank you Michael, that was great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: But, for right now what, I would really like to know about is the branch's performance, so do you have that information as well?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, absolutely David. Get that for you. I umm... [hands over report]

Quote.Speaker: Delivery man
Quote.Text: [with flowers] Can you sign?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [delivering plant to Oscar's desk] Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Nothing for me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [walks away] Join the club.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Whose it from? [to Oscar]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: My mom. [puts card in pocket]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It's frustrating, because we'd be so perfect together.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what? Here's the deal, Kelly. It would be really nice if he was in to you, right? It'd be great, but he isn't.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, it would be so great if he was.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, he's not, though. So you just gotta suck it up. You just gotta move on. Try to have some fun. Come to my poker game tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Okay, cool. Is it okay if I invite Ryan? [Jim leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Dan
Quote.Text: And that about does it, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: OK. [looks toward Craig] Craig,

Quote.Speaker: Craig
Quote.Text: Yeah. Here's the deal. I did not understand this was supposed to be a full on... like report or whatnot.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Um, I'm sorry, what did you think financial presentation meant?

Quote.Speaker: Craig
Quote.Text: I was under the impression this was, more of like... a meet and greet type deal.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: So, does that mean you don't have the numbers on your branch?

Quote.Speaker: Craig
Quote.Text: That is correct, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Craig, you realize that we're trying to decide whether if drastic steps need to be taken?

Quote.Speaker: Craig
Quote.Text: Look, I'm sorry, I didn't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, the point is, is that doesn't exactly bode well for your branch.

Quote.Speaker: Craig
Quote.Text: Oh man, you know what? Michael made that stupid movie, he doesn't get into any trouble? Maybe I should have slept with you, too. [David looks at Jan, who glares at Michael.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, ok. Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: NO, NO I'm not, I'm not, I just... I just don't know what to do anymore, Michael. I mean, we're all gonna get fired.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No you're not.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah, Michael - the CFO thinks that we slept together. Do you understand, people get fired for much less? And I just [scratches head] can't believe that you told everybody and we didn't even sleep together.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Technically, we fell asleep in the same bed. So...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, God. Michael. It was months ago. It was once, It's over. Do you understand?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. I'm sorry. I will fix this. I'll talk to him. I'll talk to David.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Surely, you cannot be serious?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am serious. And don't call me Shirley. Airplane.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Women are like wolves. If you want a wolf, you have to trap it. You have to snare it. And then you have to tame it. Keep it happy. Care for it. Feed it. Lovingly, the way an animal deserves to be loved. And my animal deserves a lot of loving.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Hey babe.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: You almost ready to go?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I guess, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: What's wrong?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nothing, it's just I had to sit here all day, while Phyllis got like an entire garden delivered to her.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: What, you're mad at me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I mean, I know that we said no big gifts, but I was kind of hoping you'd get me something for Valentine's Day.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Well, Valentine's Day isn't over. Let's get you home and you are gonna get the best sex of you life.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You understand this is a very serious situation.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No no no no no, yes I, OK, well, alright, here's the deal. It's my fault. This is, this is totally on me. Before you guys came in, I was talking to the guys. We were all chatting and I made a joke, a really dumb joke and Craig the idiot took it seriously. [Jan looks at Michael]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You made a joke?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did, it was stupid. And Craig, you saw him, he's not the sharpest tool in the shed. Although he is a tool. [David grins]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Well I don't need to explain to you that even a joke about sexual relations with your boss...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. It was borderline at best and... And Jan is a fantastic executive and has all the integrity in the world and um, I'm really sorry. It will never happen again.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh, that's fine. Let's just forget it.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Good. [Michael leaves office]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Heading out?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Alright, Beesly, Hey, Happy Valentine's Day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Bye. [Jim leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Goodnight Pam. [Leaves with oversized bear on back.]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Night Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael. Thank you again for that, really. It was very nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no big deal. Really. Sorry again.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, no, it's OK. [Puts hand in way of elevator door to stop from closing.] So, uh, Happy valentine's Day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, Happy Valentine's Day. [Jan turns and then kisses Michael. Michael looks and sees camera, Jan turns and sees camera, too. Elevator door closes.]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oy vey... schmear. [Points at Fiddler on the Roof playing at Minskoff Theatre and does a dance.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody, hello, can I have your attention, please? Since it's Valentine's Day, there's something that I wanted to say. I love the women of this office. Pam, I love you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael's got a few tricks for Valentine's Day. He found a place where you can get 12 plastic roses for $10 and he's got a great line. "Me so thorny."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love you, Angela. Yes, even you. I love you, Kelly. I love you, Meredith. This is all platonically, of course.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love ladies, always have. And you know what I think is the most attractive part of a woman's body? The brains. Because I don't think a woman is beautiful unless she is smart. And also, the brains are where the ladies get their best nasty ideas for bedroom stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You have any big Valentine's Day plans, Kev?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Not really, my fiance is out of town.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Where is she?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm not sure. Arizona? Sometimes she doesn't tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's a lot of noodles. How much sodium do you think is in that cup? This place used to be full of hookers and porn shops and it's not that way anymore. There's an old building. That one hasn't been torn down yet, but they will. They'll get to it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Happy Valentine's Day, Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Okay, you take it easy, ace.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Here you go, Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hey, thanks, ace.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I'm not good with names.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is where it's all happening. We got TGI Fridays. I'm in the picture! Sometimes I just jump into people's pictures. Lot of people have their picture taken. It's kind of a New Yorker thing. You jump in on a tourist's picture and kind of ruin it. There's an energy to New York that you just feel. Um, everybody... Don't get hit. Everybody is kind of together and everybody hates each other, but loves each other at the same time. Screw off! People just yell at each other in New York, and it's great.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm gonna go call Bob.

Quote.Speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #1
Quote.Text: So, what are you doing for Valentine's Day?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm gonna spend it with my fiance.

Quote.Speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #1
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are you guys doing?

Quote.Speaker: Vance Refrigeration Worker #1
Quote.Text: Probably go grab dinner with my girlfriend. He's gonna be pulling his pud watching Skinemax. [points to Vance Refrigeration Worker #2]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, okay. That's enough.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on, break this up.

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: Yes, sure. Mr. Scott, you can head to the conference room. The other managers are already there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Great. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, here's the thing about Jan. She talks such a big game about, "Oh there's nothing between us and stop talking about it." And "Border-line harassment when you call me at home." But let me ask you this, is it just a coincidence that this meeting is taking place on Valentine's Day? Answer, maybe, but maybe not. We shall see.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How do you spell "animalian"?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Animalian?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: None of your business. I'm writing something.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're writing something?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Forget it. I'll look it up myself.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, you know what? You do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I'm not gonna do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, yes, I'm in charge. You have to. Look it up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But I know how to spell it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Only if you tell me what you're writing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Forget it. I'll do it. But you're getting written up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So now you're writing two things?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight lives on a beet farm and he practices karate at the forth grade level. And he apparently has a girlfriend, so... I guess there really is someone for everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [phone ringing] Hi, this is Kevin. Stacy? Happy Valentine's Day. Yeah. Oh, awesome. Okay. Yeah, I'll be leaving here soon. Cool. I love you, too. Okay, 'bye. Stacy's back.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's great, man.

Quote.Speaker: Devon
Quote.Text: Hey Scott. Hey. Hey! Hey! Come here! Come here! I want to talk to you. Come here!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? It was nice to see Devon again. To sort of get closure on that whole thing.
